content.raw: Let me know if you'd like help porting the messages to `ign-msgs`. I started doing some of it because of [this](#!/osrf/gazebo_design/pull-requests/31/insertion-and-deletion-flow/diff).
content.html: Let me know if you'd like help porting the messages to ign-msgs. I started doing some of it because of this.

content.raw: if you have time to do it that would be great, thanks!
content.html: if you have time to do it that would be great, thanks!

content.raw:
Sure, I'm working on it. It's a simpler case than what I need for the other issue, so doing this first is better for me to learn how things work. I'm almost done, I'll show you a branch soon. Basically what I'm doing is:

* Move the new messages `any`, `empty`, `param` and `param_v` to ign-msgs and remove them from here.

* Use only ignition::msgs for introspection

* Keep the `ConvertAny` functions here, but use `ignition::msgs`. The reason for that is that we need them all in one place, and we can't move all of them to ign-msgs because of `common::Color` and `common::Time`. (btw, there has been [talk](#!/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2283/temperature/diff#comment-17914813) of moving Color and Time to ign-math).
content.html:
Sure, I'm working on it. It's a simpler case than what I need for the other issue, so doing this first is better for me to learn how things work. I'm almost done, I'll show you a branch soon. Basically what I'm doing is:

  • Move the new messages any, empty, param and param_v to ign-msgs and remove them from here.

  • Use only ignition::msgs for introspection

  • Keep the ConvertAny functions here, but use ignition::msgs. The reason for that is that we need them all in one place, and we can't move all of them to ign-msgs because of common::Color and common::Time. (btw, there has been talk of moving Color and Time to ign-math).

content.raw: ok sounds good to me! So would you be updating this PR to depend on ign-msgs or it's something you plan to do after this is merged?
content.html: ok sounds good to me! So would you be updating this PR to depend on ign-msgs or it's something you plan to do after this is merged?

content.raw:
Ok, so there is this [ign-msgs](https://bitbucket.org/ignitionrobotics/ign-msgs/pull-requests/10/messages-for-introspection/diff) PR, which goes with [this](#!/osrf/gazebo/branches/compare/plotting_backend_ign_msgs%0Dplotting_backend#diff) branch.

* I'll leave it up to you whether this should go in this PR or another one later

* There might be more cmake stuff going on than needed

* Adding ign-msgs will probably require changes on Jenkins
content.html:
Ok, so there is this ign-msgs PR, which goes with this branch.

  • I'll leave it up to you whether this should go in this PR or another one later

  • There might be more cmake stuff going on than needed

  • Adding ign-msgs will probably require changes on Jenkins

content.raw: ok let's focus on getting this PR merged first. I'll make the switch to ign-msgs afterwards.
content.html: ok let's focus on getting this PR merged first. I'll make the switch to ign-msgs afterwards.

content.raw: I'm wondering if we should make `introspectionItems` a protected member of `physics::Entity`, `RegisterIntrospectionItems` a pure virtual member of `Entity` and `UnregisterIntrospectionItems` perhaps a not-pure virtual?
content.html: I'm wondering if we should make introspectionItems a protected member of physics::Entity, RegisterIntrospectionItems a pure virtual member of Entity and UnregisterIntrospectionItems perhaps a not-pure virtual?

content.raw: Humm not pure for Register either, just virtual.
content.html: Humm not pure for Register either, just virtual.

So we would we end up with:

Entity:

protected: std::vector<common::URI> introspectionItems
private: virtual void RegisterIntrospectionItems();
private: virtual void UnregisterIntrospectionItems();

Model: 

private: virtual void RegisterIntrospectionItems();
private: virtual void UnregisterIntrospectionItems();

Link: 

private: virtual void RegisterIntrospectionItems();
private: virtual void UnregisterIntrospectionItems();

looks ok. @caguero ?

content.raw: In the current use cases, I think `UnregisterIntrospectionItems` could be just in the base class, but leave it virtual in case someone else wants to override it?
content.html: In the current use cases, I think UnregisterIntrospectionItems could be just in the base class, but leave it virtual in case someone else wants to override it?

content.raw: Given that `Joint` class is derived from `Base`, how about putting the Register/Unregister functions in `Base`, so that `Model`, `Link`, `Joint` all have access to the unregister function?
content.html: Given that Joint class is derived from Base, how about putting the Register/Unregister functions in Base, so that Model, Link, Joint all have access to the unregister function?

content.raw:
+1

We could maybe also look into using the `rootElement`, which is of type `Base` to get an URI for `World`.
content.html:
+1

We could maybe also look into using the rootElement, which is of type Base to get an URI for World.

should be fixed. d0634bf

removed use of `ignition::transport::waitForShutdown()` as it's available in 1.2 but [homebrew formula](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/blob/master/ignition-transport.rb#L4) uses 1.1. We can change it back once homebrew switches to ign-transport 1.2
